name: Hud
description: Functions for creating custom screens, drawing on the screen (2D), and rendering in the world (3D). Accessible from scripts via the global `Hud` variable.
overview:
## Fields
### Hud.overlays
Internal list of active 2D overlays. Do not modify this directly.

**Type**
* `java.util.Set<IDraw2D<Draw2D>>`

### Hud.renders
Internal list of active 3D renders. Do not modify this directly.

**Type**
* `java.util.Set<Draw3D>`

methods.name: createScreen
methods.description: Creates a new custom screen object.

parameters.name: dirtBG
parameters.description: If `true`, the screen will have the classic dirt background.

methods.name: openScreen
methods.description: Opens a custom screen.

methods.name: getOpenScreen
methods.description: Gets the currently open custom screen.

methods.name: createTexture
methods.description: Creates a blank texture of specific dimensions.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the new texture.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the new texture.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The unique name for the texture.

examples:
// Create a blank 16x16 texture
const blankTexture = Hud.createTexture(16, 16, "my_blank_texture");

methods.name: createTexture
methods.description: Loads a texture from a file path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The absolute path to an image file.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The unique name for the texture.

methods.name: getRegisteredTextures
methods.description: Gets a map of all registered custom textures.

methods.name: getScaleFactor
methods.description: Gets the current GUI scale factor.
examples:
const scale = Hud.getScaleFactor();
Chat.log(`GUI Scale Factor: ${scale}`);

methods.name: getOpenScreenName
methods.description: Gets the class name of the currently open screen.

methods.name: isContainer
methods.description: Checks if the currently open screen is a container (e.g. chest, inventory).

methods.name: createDraw2D
methods.description: Creates a new 2D drawing object for screen overlays.

methods.name: registerDraw2D
methods.description: Registers a 2D overlay. Deprecated: Use `overlay.register()` instead.

methods.name: unregisterDraw2D
methods.description: Unregisters a 2D overlay. Deprecated: Use `overlay.unregister()` instead.

methods.name: listDraw2Ds
methods.description: Lists all currently active 2D overlays.
examples:
const overlays = Hud.listDraw2Ds();
Chat.log(`There are ${overlays.size()} active overlays.`);

methods.name: clearDraw2Ds
methods.description: Clears all 2D overlays.
examples:
Hud.clearDraw2Ds();
Chat.log("All 2D overlays have been cleared.");

methods.name: createDraw3D
methods.description: Creates a new 3D drawing object for rendering shapes in the world.

methods.name: registerDraw3D
methods.description: Registers a 3D render. Deprecated: Use `draw.register()` instead.

methods.name: unregisterDraw3D
methods.description: Unregisters a 3D render. Deprecated: Use `draw.unregister()` instead.

methods.name: listDraw3Ds
methods.description: Lists all currently active 3D renders.
examples:
const renders = Hud.listDraw3Ds();
Chat.log(`There are ${renders.size()} active 3D renders.`);

methods.name: clearDraw3Ds
methods.description: Clears all 3D renders.
examples:
Hud.clearDraw3Ds();
Chat.log("All 3D renders have been cleared.");

methods.name: getMouseX
methods.description: Gets the current X coordinate of the mouse on the screen.
examples: const mouseX = Hud.getMouseX();

methods.name: getMouseY
methods.description: Gets the current Y coordinate of the mouse on the screen.
examples: const mouseY = Hud.getMouseY();

methods.name: getWindowWidth
methods.description: Gets the current width of the Minecraft window.
examples: const width = Hud.getWindowWidth();

methods.name: getWindowHeight
methods.description: Gets the current height of the Minecraft window.
examples: const height = Hud.getWindowHeight();
